places_to_visit.name: Belém Tower
places_to_visit.description: Belém Tower is a historic fortification on the banks of the Tagus River. It was built in the early 16th century and is a symbol of Portugal’s Age of Discoveries.

places_to_visit.name: Jerónimos Monastery
places_to_visit.description: Jerónimos Monastery is a stunning example of Manueline architecture. It houses the tombs of famous Portuguese explorers and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

places_to_visit.name: Alfama District
places_to_visit.description: The Alfama District is the oldest neighborhood in Lisbon, known for its narrow streets, historic buildings, and Fado music. It offers a glimpse into traditional Lisbon life.

places_to_visit.name: Lisbon Oceanarium
places_to_visit.description: Lisbon Oceanarium is one of the largest indoor aquariums in the world. It features a diverse range of marine life and offers educational and interactive exhibits.

places_to_visit.name: Rossio Square
places_to_visit.description: Rossio Square is a central public square in Lisbon known for its beautiful pavement designs, historic buildings, and vibrant atmosphere. It’s a great spot for people-watching and relaxation.
